instruction: I am an assistant professor of CS at HKU, I want to apply for the General Research Fund next year, I need to get some insights, so I need you to help me to organise the data. First please help me to organise the pass rate of the GRF applications of the CS departments of each school for 2019~2023 in percentage form with 2 decimal digits in a table, which I can use subsequently. Set the headers as "Year", "#Applied", "#Supported", and "Success Rate". The materials are saved under Documents/Fundings. And please save the result table as "GRF-p5y.xlsx" on my desktop.

minimal: `TYPING` Please manually open each GRF PDF file from /home/user/Documents/Fundings/grf/ (e.g., grf19.pdf, grf20.pdf, etc.) in a PDF viewer. Find the '#Applied' and '#Supported' numbers for the CS department for each year and enter them into cells B2:C6 respectively. For example, for 2019, enter '#Applied' in B2 and '#Supported' in C2.
batched: `TYPING` Please manually open each GRF PDF file from /home/user/Documents/Fundings/grf/ (e.g., grf19.pdf, grf20.pdf, etc.) in a PDF viewer. Find the '#Applied' and '#Supported' numbers for the CS department for each year and enter them into cells B2:C6 respectively. For example, for 2019, enter '#Applied' in B2 and '#Supported' in C2.
